content: tighten and secure stitches tighten and secure the tail will be used to stitch the seam so be sure it is plenty long decrease after round/row e in the round flat round 1 *k2 k2tog* repeat to end of round row 1 ws p1 *p2tog p2* repeat until last stitch p1 mc round 2 *k1 mc k1 cc k1 mc* repeat to end of round row 2 rs k1 mc *k1 mc k1 cc k1 mc* repeat to end of note cc will not be used again after this round row round 3 k all stitches note cc will not be used again after this row round 4 *k1 k2tog* repeat to end of round row 3 p all stitches round 5 k all stitches row 4 k1 *k1 k2tog* until last stitch k1 round 6 k2tog until end of round row 5 p all stitches row 6 k2tog until the end of the row cut yarn leaving a tail pull tail through remaining stitches tighten and secure cut yarn leaving a long tail pull tail through remaining stitches tighten and secure the tail will be used to stitch the seam so be sure it is plenty long thumb transfer the stitches on waste yarn back to needles for mittens worked in the round pick up two additional stitches in the gap skip this step for mittens worked flat because the extra stitches were already incorporated work in stockinette stitch for 1 25 2 2 5 or until it just covers the length of your thumb if you are working flat end on a ws row next row k2tog until the end of the round/row cut yarn leaving a tail for mittens worked flat approx 8-10 tail pull tail through remaining stitches tighten and secure finishing for mittens worked flat thread a tapestry needle onto the piece of yarn remaining after the thumb use the mattress stitch to seam the thumb starting at the tip and working down 1 25 2 2 5 or to the row where the thumb stitches were picked back up seam the side of the mitten in the same manner working from the top of the mitten down to the cuff weave in ends i hope you enjoy your new mittens
